persona.name: Marcus
persona.role: Founder, freight-tech startup, Series A in 11 weeks
persona.context: Extremely time-pressured. Has seen 100 landing pages. Deeply skeptical of learning platforms — burned by ones that didn't lead to shipping. Has $1.2M raised, domain expertise, but can't code. Evaluating in 30 seconds.
persona.primary_concern: Can this actually help me demo something for Series A investors in 8 weeks?
persona.tolerance: Very low. Bounces instantly if it feels generic or slow.

feedback.first_3_seconds: Okay, Perlea... Gradient background is kind of cool, but I'm immediately scanning for what it *does*.
feedback.headline_reaction: "Learning is building now." Vague. I need specifics. Does this build AI apps? Freight tech?
feedback.what_made_you_stay: The animated card section looks intriguing.
what_confused_you: The connection between 'learning' and what I need to *build* isn't clear.
The word 'paradigm' is a red flag for empty promises.
I don't immediately see the specific AI capabilities or tools.
missing_info: Specific examples of what I can *build* related to AI, preferably in logistics or supply chain.
A timeline - can I *really* get a demo ready in 8 weeks?
Pricing - is this even affordable for a Series A startup?
feedback.drop_off_reason: Too abstract. Doesn't quickly convince me it's worth my time or money to build a specific AI demo for my Series A.

copy_improvements.why: Directly addresses my need and provides a clear value proposition.

copy_improvements.current: The boundary between learning and building has dissolved. Perlea is designed around that truth — you develop real AI skills by doing real work, guided at every step.
copy_improvements.improved: Get hands-on experience building AI apps for logistics and supply chain. Guided tutorials and pre-built components let you launch a demo in weeks.
copy_improvements.why: Adds specificity and a concrete timeframe.
'Waitlist' implies a long wait. 'Early Access' feels more exclusive and urgent.

structural_improvements.what: Add a section showing specific demo examples or case studies related to logistics/supply chain AI.
structural_improvements.why: Provides immediate proof that this platform is relevant to my needs.

structural_improvements.what: Include a pricing estimate or range.
structural_improvements.why: Helps me quickly determine if it's financially viable.

feedback.verdict: Too vague and slow to connect to my specific need; I'd bounce and keep searching for a more targeted solution.
